result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael L A Pipp was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Causing Mental Harm to Child, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.04(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: dated 8/24/2016, filed by Attorney Simon

Defendant Michael L A Pipp in court with attorney Thomas C Simon.  Ted Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Amended information filed by the State. Defendant enters a no contest plea to count #1 of the Amended Information. Court performs plea colloquy and finds defendant guilty of count #1 of the Amended Information. Mother of victim makes statements. Father of the Victim makes statements. State gives sentencing recommendations. Atty Simon makes statements regarding sentencing. Defendant makes Statements. Attorney Simon to advise within 20 days if restitution hearing is needed. The Court Orders the Following:

COUNT#1:

Imposed Sentence of:

12.5 Years Imprisonment (Credit - 0)
-	7.5 Years of Initial Confinement
-	5 Years of Extended Supervision


Conditions of Extended Supervision:
-Provide DNA sample if not yet provided  and pay surcharge;
-No contact with victim listed in the criminal complaint, their family, or their residence. 
-Sex offender treatment as deemed appropriate by Agent. 
-No contact with anyone under the age of 18 without Agent approval.
-Any internet use to be monitored and approved by Agent.
-Required to register as a sexual offender until further order of the Court


Restitution: $625.49  (to be paid out of cash bond posted)
Cost: $ 268.00 (to be paid as a condition of extended supervision)
DNA surcharge: $250.00 (to be paid as a condition of extended supervision)

Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program
Defendant is not eligible for the Substance Abuse Program

Felony warnings, immigration warnings,  voting rights and firearms warnings given.
